tournament.name: NYSE Open VIII  - New York Stax Exchange

decks.notes: The deck revolves around using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Oko, Thief of Crowns. It includes a lot of card advantage and countermagic to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also runs a Show and Tell package as an alternative way to put big threats into play. The lands are optimized to support the deck's strategy and provide all the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up powerful win conditions like Time Vault combo or generating value through cards like Paradoxical Outcome. It also includes cards that provide card advantage and manipulation, like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Vampiric Tutor. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value by allowing for recurring of low-cost permanents or creatures. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, outvalue the opponent, and set up game-winning combos for a strategic advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements and efficient mana acceleration to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling key combo pieces for a win condition. It includes a strong mix of countermagic, removal, card draw, and tutor effects to control the game tempo. The inclusion of powerful vintage staples like Ancestral Recall, Time Vault, and Black Lotus allows for explosive plays and overwhelming advantage. The deck's reliance on Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience in longer games. Ultimately, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through precise decision-making and resource management.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Mental Misstep to counter opponent spells, while also having removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Repeal to deal with threats. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Mana Crypt for additional win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through card advantage and control elements.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around using various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and disruption to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes artifacts and mana acceleration to generate card advantage and ramp into powerful spells like Time Walk and Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and flexibility, allowing for recursion of key cards and providing a constant threat on the battlefield. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts such as Moxen, Coveted Jewel, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring to generate mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate even more mana. The deck also utilizes cards like Time Vault and Voltaic Key for extra turns, as well as powerful blue spells like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall for card advantage and control. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful engine of artifacts and card draw to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Hullbreacher to control the opponent's resources while generating card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Vigor to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration with Moxen and fast lands like Urza's Saga to quickly deploy threats like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The overall strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing a strong board presence with efficient creatures. It utilizes disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to slow down the opponent, while also using countermagic such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its threats. The deck also has powerful card draw and selection spells like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional value and threat diversity. The deck is designed to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo and win the game by using a combination of efficient card draw, disruption, and protection spells. By utilizing powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, along with cantrips and counterspells, the deck can efficiently find and cast Doomsday to set up a winning pile. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition, allowing the player to win the game upon resolving Doomsday. The deck is focused on quickly and efficiently winning the game through a well-executed combo sequence.

The deck focuses on setting up a game-winning combo with Doomsday, using cards like Thassa's Oracle and Street Wraith to manipulate the deck and win the game in one turn. The deck also includes powerful disruption tools such as Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. It utilizes various tutors and cantrips to assemble the combo quickly, while also having access to cards like Time Walk and Necropotence for additional value and card advantage. The deck runs a mana base that can support its powerful spells, ensuring a consistent and efficient game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Ancestral Recall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up its own resources. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den offer alternative win conditions that can catch opponents off guard. Overall, the deck prioritizes resource management and disruption to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards and mana acceleration to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while generating card advantage through draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo provides an additional win condition. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value by recasting low-cost permanents from the graveyard. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent using a combination of disruption and card advantage.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures, like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex, to slow down the opponent while applying pressure with aggressive creatures such as Witch Enchanter and Archon of Emeria. Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void prevent opponents from easily casting spells, while cards like Vexing Bauble and Seasoned Dungeoneer provide card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on aggressive play with strong tempo swings utilizing the Bazaar of Baghdad ability to fill the graveyard quickly and bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One. The deck also utilizes artifact hate with Null Rod and Crucible of Worlds to disrupt opponents' strategies, while utilizing efficient mana ramp with Mishra's Workshop and Urza's Saga. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Hexdrinker provide additional ways to control the board and protect key threats. The deck aims to overpower opponents quickly and consistently with its aggressive gameplay.

The deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and powerful spells to control the game while also applying pressure to the opponent. It includes a variety of mana acceleration and disruption cards, along with powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up a board presence to deliver a lethal blow. The deck aims to out-value the opponent with efficient threats and powerful spells, while also disrupting their key plays to gain an advantage and secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using disruption and removal spells to control the game. By using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Repeal, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Lrien Revealed and Draw Through Time to ensure that the player has a constant stream of resources. With the ability to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's plans, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in a control mirror match.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card selection to disrupt and control the game while leveraging artifacts and threats like Lurrus of the Dream-Den for value and advantage. The deck aims to control the game's tempo and resources, limiting opponent's options while setting up win conditions like Time Vault or efficient creatures. The deck also includes various card draw options to ensure consistent access to key pieces and maintain card advantage throughout the game.

This Doomsday combo deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary cards to win the game with a Doomsday pile that uses Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. The deck includes efficient card draw and selection spells, along with disruptive countermagic to protect the combo. By carefully planning out the Doomsday pile and navigating through opponents' disruption, this deck can achieve a quick and decisive victory in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with Dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, allowing you to constantly bring back creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, you aim to dredge through your deck rapidly, triggering abilities like Creeping Chill and Bridge from Below to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck also includes disruption and protection in the form of Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to ensure your combo goes off smoothly.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts while using Urza's Saga to tutor for powerful artifacts like Nettlecyst and Crucible of Worlds. The deck also utilizes Mishra's Workshop to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays early in the game. The inclusion of Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Mystic Forge provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Null Rod and Sphere of Resistance disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator and Trinisphere provide additional utility and disruption to shut down opposing strategies.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Foundry Inspector, Walking Ballista, and Patchwork Automaton, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sphere of Resistance. It also utilizes powerful mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to deploy threats ahead of schedule. The deck focuses on creating a fast and disruptive board state to put pressure on the opponent and restrict their options, ultimately aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using cards like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and counterspells while using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play. The deck also utilizes cards like Show and Tell and Tinker to quickly put threats on the board. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful draw spells, tutors, and mana acceleration to ensure consistency and potentially win the game quickly through a combination of control elements and powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while controlling the board with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Bolas's Citadel to generate mana and card advantage. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant board presence through the use of powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on generating fast mana with Moxen, Sol Ring, and other artifacts to power out a combo involving Paradoxical Outcome. The key combo pieces include Mana Crypt, Voltaic Key, and Manifold Key to untap mana rocks and generate significant advantage with Paradoxical Outcome. The deck also utilizes powerful mana accelerants like Mana Vault and Grim Monolith to further enable the combo. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and disruptive creatures like Hullbreacher. The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly and win through its combo pieces.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel, and then using cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and replay those artifacts for even more mana. The goal is to assemble the Time Vault + Manifold Key combo or generate a massive amount of mana to cast a game-ending spell like Tinker or Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also runs disruption in the form of Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect its combo.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of storm count and mana to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony and Bolas's Citadel. It includes a variety of fast mana accelerants and card draw spells to help set up the combo. The deck also contains disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game through a powerful storm-based combo.

The deck focuses on using efficient counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and out-value the opponent. By combining powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade with alternative win conditions like Lrien Revealed and March of Otherworldly Light, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own strategy. The inclusion of companions like Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds additional consistency and resilience to the deck's game plan, making it a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponents' plays with counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia. The deck aims to generate card advantage with cantrips and draw spells while gradually building a powerful board state with Urza's Sagas and efficient threats. The inclusion of Lurrus as a companion allows for recursion of key permanents and offers additional value in longer games. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of disruption and powerful card advantage engines.
